com4j
Class Wrapper

java.lang.Object
  com4j.Wrapper
All Implemented Interfaces:
Com4jObject, InvocationHandler
public final class Wrapper
extends Object
implements InvocationHandler, Com4jObject

InvocationHandler that backs up a COM object.

Author:
Kohsuke Kawaguchi (kk@kohsuke.org)

dispose

public void dispose()
Description copied from interface: Com4jObject
Releases a reference to the wrapped COM object.

Since Java objects tend to live longer in memory until it's GC-ed, and applications have generally no control over when it's GC-ed, calling the dispose method earlier enables applications to dispose the COM objects deterministically.

Specified by:
dispose in interface Com4jObject

is

public <T extends Com4jObject> boolean is(Class<T> comInterface)
Description copied from interface: Com4jObject
Checks if this COM object implements a given interface.

This is just a convenience method that behaves as follows: 

 return queryInterface(comInterface)!=null;

Specified by:
is in interface Com4jObject
Returns:
true if the wrapped COM object implements a given interface.

queryInterface

public <T extends Com4jObject> T queryInterface(Class<T> comInterface)
Description copied from interface: Com4jObject
Invokes the queryInterface of the wrapped COM object and attempts to obtain a different interface of the same object.

Specified by:
queryInterface in interface Com4jObject
Returns:
null if the queryInterface fails.

advise

public <T> com4j.EventProxy<?> advise(Class<T> eventInterface,
                                      T object)
Description copied from interface: Com4jObject
Subscribes to the given event interface of this object.

Specified by:
advise in interface Com4jObject
Parameters:
eventInterface - The event interface definition. This interface/class has to have an IID annotation that designates the event interface GUID, and also methods annotated with DISPID that designates what methods are event methods. Must not be null.
object - The object that receives events.
Returns:
Always non-null. Call EventCookie.close() to shut down the event subscription.

hashCode

public final int hashCode()
Description copied from interface: Com4jObject
Hash code consistent with Com4jObject.equals(java.lang.Object) }.

This method queries the IUnknown* value to the wrapped COM object and returns its pointer bit image as integer.

The net result is that the identity of Com4jObject is based on the identity of the underlying COM objects. Two Com4jObject that are holding different interfaces of the same COM object is considered "equal".

Specified by:
hashCode in interface Com4jObject
Overrides:
hashCode in class Object

equals

public final boolean equals(Object rhs)
Description copied from interface: Com4jObject
Tests the identity of two COM objects.

This consists of doing IUnknown::QueryInterface on two interfaces and test the bit image of the resulting IUnknown*.

If one COM object implements two interfaces, in Java you see them as two different objects. Thus you cannot rely on == to check if they represent the same COM object.

Specified by:
equals in interface Com4jObject
Overrides:
equals in class Object
